008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.circle.AlgebraicCircle;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.circle.GeometricCircle;
020
021/**
022 * Common interface for all algebraic circle fits.
023 * 
024 * @author WB
025 *
026 */
027public interface CircleFitAlgebraic {
028        
029        public enum FitType {
030                KasaA,
031                KasaB,
032                KasaC,
033                Pratt,
034                Taubin,
035                HyperSimple,
036                HyperStable
037        }
038        
039        /**
040         * Creates and returns a new circle fit instance of the specified
041         * type for the given sample points.
042         * 
043         * @param type the circle fit type
044         * @param points an array of 2D sample points
045         * @return a new circle fit instance
046         * 
047         * @see FitType
048         */
049        public static CircleFitAlgebraic getFit(FitType type, Pnt2d[] points) {
050                switch (type) {
051                case KasaA:             return new CircleFitKasaA(points);
052                case KasaB:             return new CircleFitKasaB(points);
053                case KasaC:             return new CircleFitKasaC(points);
054                case Pratt:             return new CircleFitPratt(points);
055                case Taubin:            return new CircleFitTaubin(points);
056                case HyperSimple:       return new CircleFitHyperSimple(points);
057                case HyperStable:       return new CircleFitHyperStable(points);
058                }
059                throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown algebraic fit type: " + type);
060        }
061        
062        /**
063         * Returns parameters (A, B, C, D) of the {@link AlgebraicCircle}
064         * or {@code null} if the fit was unsuccessful.
065         * Parameters are not normalized.
066         * 
067         * @return the algebraic circle parameters or {@code null}
068         */
069        public double[] getParameters();
070        
071        
072        /**
073         * Returns a {@link AlgebraicCircle} instance for this fit 
074         * or {@code null} if the fit was unsuccessful.
075         * @return a {@link AlgebraicCircle} instance or null
076         */
077        public default AlgebraicCircle getAlgebraicCircle() {
078                double[] p = getParameters();
079                return (p == null) ? null : new AlgebraicCircle(p);
080        }
081        
082        /**
083         * Returns a {@link GeometricCircle} instance for this fit 
084         * or {@code null} if the fit was unsuccessful.
085         * @return a {@link GeometricCircle} instance or null
086         */
087        public default GeometricCircle getGeometricCircle() {
088                double[] q = this.getParameters();      // assumed to be (A, B, C, D)
089                if (q == null || isZero(q[0])) {        // (abs(2 * A / s) < (1 / Rmax))
090                        return null;                                    // return a straight line?
091                }
092                else {
093                        return new GeometricCircle(getAlgebraicCircle());
094                }
095        }
096        
097        /**
098         * Used to transform the algebraic parameter vector for sample data
099         * shifted to the reference point specified.
100         * If qq is the parameter vector for the data centered at (xr, yr),
101         * the original parameters q are obtained as
102         * <pre>q = M * qq</pre>
103         * 
104         * @param xr reference point (x)
105         * @param yr reference point (y)
106         * @return the transformation matrix
107         */
108        static RealMatrix getDecenteringMatrix(double xr, double yr) {
109                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][]
110                                {{ 1, 0, 0, 0 },
111                                 {-2*xr, 1, 0, 0 },
112                                 {-2*yr, 0, 1, 0 },
113                                 {sqr(xr) + sqr(yr), -xr, -yr, 1}});
114        }
115        
116        /**
117         * Normalize parameter vector q=(A,B,C,D) by enforcing 
118         * the constraint B^2 + C^2 - 4 A D = 1.
119         * 
120         * @param q original parameter vector
121         * @return normalized parameter vector
122         */
123        public default double[] normalizeP(double[] q) {
124                final double A = q[0];
125                final double B = q[1];
126                final double C = q[2];
127                final double D = q[3];
128                double s  = Math.sqrt(sqr(B) + sqr(C) - 4 * A * D);
129                return new double[] {A/s, B/s, C/s, D/s};
130        }
131}
